sailpoint.connector

Class JDBCConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.connector.CollectorServices
      • sailpoint.connector.AbstractConnector
        • sailpoint.connector.JDBCConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connector

    public class JDBCConnector
extends AbstractConnector
    A connector that can be used to read data from JDBC enabled database engines.

    This connector using configuration options to drive the data that is fetched from the database.

    For simple single table implementations the schema can be used exclusively to configure the connector. The native ObjectType in the schema defines the table name when generating the sql.

    For more complex situations the sql can manually be assigned using the sql configuration parameter. JDBCConnector.CONFIG_SQL_STATEMENT The select statement for the statement will drive the ResultSet that is returned from the query. For each ResultSet returned by the sql a buildMap rule is called to transform the ResultSet into a Map object. The buildMap is where all of the per row transformations can take place and there is a default static method JDBCConnector.buildMapFromResultSet(ResultSet) that can be called from rules to transform the data into a Map.

    Once each row has been transformed into a Map object it is then transformed to a ResourceObject which is used to represent each unique user or group in the data source.

    The default methods use the Application's Schema to coerce the sql datatype values into our simple Boolean, String, Long, Integer and Date values. These behaviors can be overridden using the Connector.CONFIG_TRANSFORMATION_RULE configuration item.

    See Also:
    JDBCConnector.buildMapFromResultSet(ResultSet)

      • CONFIG_PARTITION_SQL_STATEMENTS

        public static final java.lang.String CONFIG_PARTITION_SQL_STATEMENTS
        The application configuration that holds the list of partitions that should be executed. Each item in the list should be a different statement covering a separate part of the database.

        Constant Field Values

      • CONFIG_PARTITION_NAMES

        The application configuration that holds the list of partition names that should be used. The names' order should correspond to the statements' order.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONFIG_EXCEPTION_SIMULATION_COUNT

        public static final java.lang.String CONFIG_EXCEPTION_SIMULATION_COUNT
        An Application attribute that holds the simulated exception count. The object iterator will throw after processing this many accounts.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONFIG_STATEMENT_FETCH_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String CONFIG_STATEMENT_FETCH_SIZE
        An optional setting that can be specified to override a JDBC connector's default row pre-fetch. For example, Oracle's JDBC driver's default pre- fetch is 10 rows. Other JDBC drivers may have different values. An Application might want to change this depending on the size of data coming from the remote system (row size in bytes) or other factors. If not specified the JDBC Driver's default is left in place. See also: CONFIG_RESULT_SET_FETCH_SIZE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONFIG_RESULT_SET_FETCH_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String CONFIG_RESULT_SET_FETCH_SIZE
        An optional setting that can be specified to override a JDBC connector's default row pre-fetch. This one applies to the ResultSet instead of the Prepared Statement. See also: CONFIG_STATEMENT_FETCH_SIZE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONFIG_DELTA_AGGREGATION

      • iterateObjects

        public JDBCConnector.JDBCObjectIterator iterateObjects(java.lang.String objectType,
                                              Filter filter,
                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> options)
                                                throws sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        Description copied from interface: Connector
        Return an Iterator of ResourceObjects.

        Parameters:
        objectType - Type of object to fetch, Account, Group, Permission
        filter - Possibly-null Filter to apply to the query that produces the iterator. If null, all objects of the given type are returned.
        options - A Map of extra options

        Returns:
        An Iterator of ResourceObjects Each Resource Object will have a required unique native identity and displayName.

        Throws:
        sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        See Also:
        Connector.OP_ATTRIBUTE_NAMES, Connector.OP_ALLOW_BRUTE_FORCE_SEARCH

      • discoverSchema

        public Schema discoverSchema(java.lang.String objectType,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> options)
                      throws sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        Discover the attributes that will be returned when we iterate over the accounts and groups.

        Get the column names by executing the sql for the objectType and reading back the column names from the ResultSet's MetaData.

        Specified by:

      • buildMapFromResultSet

        @Deprecated
public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> buildMapFromResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet result,
                                                                                Schema schema)
                                                                              throws sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        Deprecated. 

        This method is typically called from a buildMap rule as the first thing in the rule to build a Map object to prevent each implementation from having to do this same bit of conversion.

        The schema argument can be null and is not used and is allowed here for historical purposes only.

        Returns:
        Map representing the ResultSet or null if there are no columns with values in the result.
        Throws:
        sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        Since:
        2.0
        See Also:
        ResultSetMetaData, JDBCConnector.buildMapFromResultSet(ResultSet)

      • buildMapFromResultSet

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> buildMapFromResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet result)
                                                                              throws sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        Given a ResultSet, for each of the column names put a new key/value pair into the map that represents the results set column value.

        There will be a key for each of the values selected in the SQL. This code builds the column names using the ResultSet's meta-data object (ResultSetMetaData).

        This method is typically the first method that is called in a buildMap rule to build a base map that can then be altered to suite a customers needs.

        Each call to the jdbc build map rule is handed several things including and attribute named 'result' that represents the JDBC ResultSet for each row returned from the sql query. 

            
     // Here is an example of how it might be used in a buildmap
     // rule
     Map defaultMap = JDBCConnector.buildMapFromResultSet(result);
     // make your customizations/transformations               
          
     return defaultMap;
        Throws:
        sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException

      • closeConnection

        protected void closeConnection(java.sql.Connection connection)
        Call close on the connection, this method performs null check and catches exceptions which are logged to the error log if thrown.
        Parameters:
        connection - Open Connection

      • closeStatement

        protected void closeStatement(java.sql.Statement statement)
        Call close() on the statement, performs null check and logs exceptions thrown when trying to close.

        All statements should be closed when they are no longer needed.

        Parameters:
        statement -

      • closeResult

        protected void closeResult(java.sql.ResultSet resultset)
        Call close() on the ResultSet, performs null check and logs exceptions thrown when trying to close.

        All results should be closed when they are no longer needed.

        Parameters:
        resultset - The resultSet the needs to be closed

      • getIteratorPartitions

        public java.util.List<Partition> getIteratorPartitions(java.lang.String objectType,
                                              int suggestedPartitionCount,
                                              Filter filter,
                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> ops)
                                                throws sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        Description copied from class: AbstractConnector
        Default implementation returns null to indicate the connector does not have any partitions defined.

        Subclasses that can implement this method should override this method.

        Specified by:
        getIteratorPartitions in interface Connector
        Overrides:
        getIteratorPartitions in class AbstractConnector
        Parameters:
        objectType - The type of object for which to return partitions.
        suggestedPartitionCount - The caller's suggested partition count, but the application config should ultimately determine the number of partitions.
        ops - Provides additional options in the form of a Map
        Returns:
        List of Objects used to configure each partition
        Throws:
        ConnectorException
        See Also:
        {@inheritDoc}

      • iterateObjects

        public CloseableIterator<ResourceObject> iterateObjects(Partition partition)
                                                 throws sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        Return an iterator over the objects defined in the Partition object.

        Allow the Partition configuration to drive the iteration. Just pass the Partition object into the iteratObjects call through the options map and allow its statement to override the one defined on the application.

        Specified by:
        iterateObjects in interface Connector
        Overrides:
        iterateObjects in class AbstractConnector
        Parameters:
        partition - The Partition to iterate over.
        Returns:
        CloseableIterator over the objects defined by the Partition.
        Throws:
        ConnectorException
        See Also:
        Connector.getIteratorPartitions(String, int, Filter, Map)
